com.mapdigit.drawing

Class SolidBrush

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapdigit.drawing.Brush
      • com.mapdigit.drawing.SolidBrush

  • public final class SolidBrush
extends Brush
    Defines a brush of a single color. Brushes are used to fill graphics shapes, such as rectangles, ellipses, pies, polygons, and paths. This class cannot be inherited.
    © Copyright 2010 Guidebee Pty Ltd.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.mapdigit.drawing.Brush

        NO_CYCLE, REFLECT, REPEAT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SolidBrush(Color color)
      Creates an sRGB brush with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
      SolidBrush(int rgb)
      Creates an opaque sRGB brush with the specified combined RGB value consisting of the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
      SolidBrush(int rgba, boolean hasalpha)
      Creates an sRGB brush with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
      SolidBrush(int r, int g, int b)
      Creates an opaque sRGB brush with the specified red, green, and blue values in the range (0 - 255).
      SolidBrush(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Creates an sRGB brush with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range (0 - 255).

      Color getColor()
      get the color of the solid brush.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SolidBrush

        public SolidBrush(int r,
          int g,
          int b)
        Creates an opaque sRGB brush with the specified red, green, and blue values in the range (0 - 255). The actual color used in rendering depends on finding the best match given the color space available for a given output device. Alpha is defaulted to 255.
        Parameters:
        r - the red component
        g - the green component
        b - the blue component
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r, g or b are outside of the range 0 to 255, inclusive

      • SolidBrush

        public SolidBrush(int r,
          int g,
          int b,
          int a)
        Creates an sRGB brush with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range (0 - 255).
        Parameters:
        r - the red component
        g - the green component
        b - the blue component
        a - the alpha component
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r, g, b or a are outside of the range 0 to 255, inclusive

      • SolidBrush

        public SolidBrush(int rgb)
        Creates an opaque sRGB brush with the specified combined RGB value consisting of the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7. The actual color used in rendering depends on finding the best match given the color space available for a particular output device. Alpha is defaulted to 255.
        Parameters:
        rgb - the combined RGB components

      • SolidBrush

        public SolidBrush(int rgba,
          boolean hasalpha)
        Creates an sRGB brush with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7. If the hasalpha argument is false, alpha is defaulted to 255.
        Parameters:
        rgba - the combined RGBA components
        hasalpha - true if the alpha bits are valid; false otherwise

      • SolidBrush

        public SolidBrush(Color color)
        Creates an sRGB brush with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7. If the hasalpha argument is false, alpha is defaulted to 255.
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the brush

        get the color of the solid brush.

      • getTransparency

        public int getTransparency()
        Returns the transparency mode for this Color. This is required to implement the Paint interface.
        Specified by:
        getTransparency in class Brush
        Returns:
        this Color object's transparency mode.
